content:
Hola, Van mis respuestas:

¿Hay alguna forma de extraer todos esos correos de años anteriores a un archivo externo de consulta, para almacenarlo en un disco externo y así liberar espacio del disco del equipo?

-Hay complementos como ImportExportTools NG que permiten exportar e importar correos con gran variedad de alternativas: https://addons.thunderbird.net/es/thunderbird/addon/importexporttools-ng/

También tengo la duda de, si hay forma de hacerlo, ¿cómo evitar que vuelvan a sincronizarse correos con el buzón IMAP de Google, para que no vuelva a llenarse de los correos antiguos?

-Sincronizar por fecha? podes decirle al Thunderbird que muestre los correos con cierto tiempo de antigüedad: días, semanas, meses, años, ejemplo: a partir de 2 años Herramientas->Configuración de cuentas->Sincronizar y almacenamiento: Espacio en disco

Si se ha resuelto la consulta agradeceríamos marcar como solucionada para que sirva a otros usuarios. ¡Gracias!
creator: pcp04

content:
some of the same common issues come from people who have a phone with a bad connection from their provider's server. where the email remains on the server, it will also be pop or imap in use, this email will remain in the inbox of the server. and will continuously deliver to you. if this phenomenon continues to occur or even occurs in the strangest places in your software, they sometimes speak of a ghost email.

The best is to implement the text that I sent to you for this.

I will send you the necessary software. if problems still arise after this. feel free to email back.

https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/102.8.0/releasenotes/

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/cannot-send-messages


Greetings firefox volunteer.

content:
David thank you for your reply. Unfortunately when I did what you mentioned about highlighting & right clicking I only got a pop up window saying to Write, Print or Delete. I wonder if it is the version I am running. 102.7.2 So I started monkeying around & accidentally figured it out.

I clicked on Tools, then Address Book and then with hovering my cursor over Personal Address Book or Collected Addresses on the left side of my screen, 3 dots appeared to the right in the box. I clicked on these 3 dots and Properties, Print & Export appear. Hooray. Pay Dirt. Export.

Thanks David for replying. That way I kept trying. Gary

creator: m.sammet

content: Okay, just a guess here... If you have other accounts, check to see if one of them was using a component of the deleted account. For example, it sometimes happens that a person is using two accounts for the same smtp server. My suggestion that 'may' verify this is to -highlight the account, click the account actions and remove account button as before. - now, click help>moretroubleshootinginformation and scroll down to where it displays a matrix for MAIL AND NEWS ACCOUNTS. See if any component of the deleted account appears there. - another test is to click settings>privacy&security, click 'saved passwords'. That will cause a matrix to display, showing every server in the profile. This listing should be a multiple of two. If not, that may be a hint on the problem. Look to see if any component of the deleted account appears.
creator: davidsk

content: Thank you very much. I understood and executed the second part. But it didn't do anything. The account will be back on reboot. creator: m.sammet

Have you tried rebooting your device in safe mode with networking to see if it might be something else on the system causing issues. Microsoft offer instructions here.

content:
Ok, i figured out the problem. I host a local xampp service that provides apache and mysql database for some development projects. having those services running was stopping my connection to the google accounts.

Thanks!
creator: colbyotte

content: More precisely their use of the localhost adapter on the same ports as Thunderbird and consuming the data for the initial oauth Authentication was probably the issue.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Thunderbird uses UTC time. This is based on Windows system on the locale in windows settings. As you can see mine is set to UTC +9:30 The actual time you have set is not referenced as it is not relevant to the person sending the mail, or the mail server processing the mail so universal time is used with appropriate offsets to correct for geography.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
That makes little sense. Charter bought out a number of other competitors in 2016 and renamed itself spectrum. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charter_Communications So I really have no idea why you would be suggesting that server has something to do with Thunderbird.

Mostly I find folk with issue with settings not working when they are using those suggested by their provider have an issue with their antivirus usually. This is best tested using your operating system in safe mode with networking. See https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/start-your-pc-in-safe-mode-in-windows-92c27cff-db89-8644-1ce4-b3e5e56fe234
creator: MattAuSupport
